tests_run: All 116 tests passed including 6 existing storage atomicity tests
uv run ruff check passed with no errors
risks: Backup files are created in the same directory as the main file, which could fail if the directory is read-only
Backup rotation uses simple file renaming which could theoretically fail in rare filesystem race conditions (mitigated by graceful degradation)
Large JSON files (approaching 10MB limit) will create equally large backup files, consuming disk space
limitations: Backup retention is fixed at runtime initialization, cannot be changed without creating new TodoStorage instance
No automatic cleanup of old backup files from previous runs (only manages backups created during current session)
Backup files are not compressed or compressed differently from main file
No timestamp in backup filenames - rotation order is implicit
